intro: Astragalus rivashensis, commonly known as the Rivash mountain milkvetch, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellow to pale green flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. Astragalus rivashensis is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh climatic conditions. Its ecological role includes supporting pollinators and contributing to soil stabilization in its native habitat.
